metadata.title: CVE-2019-9877 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: There is an invalid memory access vulnerability in the functionTextPage::findGaps() located at TextOutputDev.c in Xpdf 4.01, which can(for example) be triggered by sending a crafted pdf file to the pdftopsbinary. It allows an attacker to cause Denial of Service (Segmentationfault) or possibly have unspecified other impact.

criterions.comment: xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
poppler: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ipe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
